titleStmt.title:
Verses wrote on the great Storm
which happen'd about Xmass 1722. Dr 08. H────
Bp. of ──── and Dean Berkley were then
on board the Yatch, and in great danger of
being lost.

lg.l: Pallas the Goddess chaste and wise,
Descending lately from the Skies,
To Neptune went to beg in form,
He'd give his orders for a Storm;
A Storm to drown that Rascal H────
And she wou'd kindly thank him for't.
A Wretch whom English Rogues to Spite her
Had lately honour'd with a Mitre.
Neptune who favour'd her request,
Assur'd her he wou'd do his best
But Venus had been there before,
Pleaded the Bishop lov'd a Whore,
And had enlarg'd her Empire wide
He own'd no Deity beside.
By Sea and Land where e're you find him
Without a Mistress hang or drown him.
om.
om.
If H──── must Sink she grieves to tell it,
She'l not have left one single Prelate,
For to tell truth, she did intend him
Elect of Cyprus, in Commendum
om.
om.
Then Proteus urg'd the same request
But half in earnest, half in jest.
Said he, great Sovereign of the Main,
To drown him all attempts are vain,
H──── can assume more Form's than J,
A Rake, or Bully, Pimp, or Spy;
Can Creep or Run, can Fly or Swim,
All motions are alike to him:
Turn him adrift and you shall find,
He knows to sail with every wind:
Or throw him over-board, He'l ride
As well against, as with the Tyde.
But Pallas you've apply'd too late,
For tis decree'd by Jove and Fate,
That Jreland must be destroy'd
And who but H──── must be employ'd.
You need not then have been so pert
Jn sending Bolton to Clonfert.
J found you did it by your grinning,
Your business is to mind your Spinning;
But how you came to interpose,
Jn making Bishops, no man knows;
om.
om.
But if you must have your Petition,
There's Berkley in the same condition
Look there he stands, and tis but just
Jf one must drown the other must;
But if you'll leave us Bishop Judas
Wee'l give you Berkley for Bermudas.
But if 'twill gratify your spi\ght·overwriting·te\,
To put him in a plagu'y fright,
Althô tis hardly worth the cost
You soon shall See him soundly tost.
You'l find him Swear, blaspheme and damn,
And every moment take a Dram.
His ghostly visage with an air
Of Reprobation and Despair
Or when some hiding hole he seeks
For fear the rest shou'd say he Squeeks;
Or as ·Brigadier Fitzpatrick drown'd with his Mistress comeing from England in the year 1696. Fitzpatrick did before
Resolve to perish with his whore.
Or when he raves and roars and swears,
And but for shame wou'd say his Prayers
Or wou'd you see his Spirits sink,
Relaxing downwards in a Stink;
If such a sight as this can please you
Good Mrs Pallas pray be easie
To Neptune speak and he'll consent
But H──── comes back the Knave he went.
The Goddess who conceiv'd a hope
That H──── was destin'd to a rope
Believ'd it best to condescend
To spare a foe to save a friend,
But fearing Berkley might be scar'd
She left him Virtue for a Guard.
